section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਜਗਿ ਜੀਵਨੁ ਐਸਾ ਸੁਪਨੇ ਜੈਸਾ ਜੀਵਨੁ ਸੁਪਨ ਸਮਾਨੰ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The life of the world is only a dream; life is just a dream.

transliteration.text: jag jīvan aisā supanē jaisā jīvan supan samānan .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਸਾਚੁ ਕਰਿ ਹਮ ਗਾਠਿ ਦੀਨੀ ਛੋਡਿ ਪਰਮ ਨਿਧਾਨੰ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Believing it to be true, I grasped at it, and abandoned the supreme treasure. ||1||

transliteration.text: sāch kar ham gāth dīnī shōd param nidhānan .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Father, I have enshrined love and affection for Maya,

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਗਿਆਨੁ ਰਤਨੁ ਹਿਰਿ ਲੀਨ੍ਹ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: which has taken the jewel of spiritual wisdom away from me. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jin giān ratan hir līnh .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਨੈਨ ਦੇਖਿ ਪਤੰਗੁ ਉਰਝੈ ਪਸੁ ਨ ਦੇਖੈ ਆਗਿ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The moth sees with its eyes, but it still becomes entangled; the insect does not see the fire.

transliteration.text: nain dēkh patang urajhai pas n dēkhai āg .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਕਾਲ ਫਾਸ ਨ ਮੁਗਧੁ ਚੇਤੈ ਕਨਿਕ ਕਾਮਿਨਿ ਲਾਗਿ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Attached to gold and woman, the fool does not think of the noose of Death. ||2||

transliteration.text: kāl phās n mugadh chētai kanik kāmin lāg .2.

text: ਕਰਿ ਬਿਚਾਰੁ ਬਿਕਾਰ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਤਰਨ ਤਾਰਨ ਸੋਇ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Reflect upon this, and abandon sin; the Lord is a boat to carry you across.

transliteration.text: kar bichār bikār parahar taran tāran sōi .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਜਗਜੀਵਨੁ ਐਸਾ ਦੁਤੀਅ ਨਾਹੀ ਕੋਇ ॥੩॥੫॥੨੭॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, such is the Lord, the Life of the World; there is no one equal to Him. ||3||5||27||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr jagajīvan aisā dutī nāhī kōi .3.5.27.
